The location is perfect for visiting Rockefeller Center (easy walking distance) or Times Square (also walking distance but a bit further, probably 15 minutes or so -- unless it pours while you're there like it did for us and forces you into a cab instead!). Not staying in Times Square ended up being a HUGE blessing -- I haven't been there in many years but don't remember the absolute CRUSH of people we encountered there. It was so bad that you literally couldn't move on the sidewalks at certain points, and you just had to put your shoulder down and force your way through the loitering crowd. The sidewalks for 10-15 people deep in many spots. We did visit on the first weekend of April school vacation, which I'm hoping accounted for some of the crowds, but I don't know. It was equally bad on Sunday night as it was on a Saturday. So be warned if you choose a Times Square hotel. Your much better bet would be to choose somewhere a little distance away, such as the Marriott East Side.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel - probably not the best choice for tourists”
Reviews.Author: keb1234
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night when working in the area. It is on Lexington around 49th street. The location was perfect for me because I was working nearby, but I ended up changing hotels because my husband was coming in for the weekend and it was kind of a hike to the touristy things. It is about 2 blocks from the subway station and I never had a problem getting a taxi, so it is fairly easy to get anywhere. The hotel was nice and up-to-date and my room was fairly large for a NYC hotel room. I have read other reviews about the noise, but I thought it was very quiet (I did have a room on the back of the building). I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Shreejoyee
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel on business purpose and stayed there for 16 days.The hotel has a heritage value with grand exteriors and a decent lobby.The reception staffs were very cordial and helped out with each and every small query.The room was comfortable and big as per US standards.Room service and dining restaurants have good options for meals.The location of the hotel is convenient for both traveling on business or tourist purpose. The only thing that acted as a dampener during my stay was the mal-functioning of one of the elevators. Otherwise a great hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: Goose007
Reviews.Content: Lots of noise on street down below while trying to sleep at night. Here's why--A thick metal plate has replaced the surface of the street at the intersection of Lexington and 49th so that every time a vehicle drives over it at anything more than a crawl it makes this loud boom boom noise! It has been this way for months and NYC doesn't fix it so your are hearing it repetitively and it is loud even from higher floors. And of course you have the usual, constant horn beeping all day and night up until the wee hours when there is a reprieve. (I guess the cabbies must sleep sometime!) But that part you have to accept in NYC. The bedding was a bit much. The thick down comforter was way too warm for April. And without it all you had was a sheet otherwise. I did find a grubby blanket in a zippered bag in the closet to use. I hoped it was clean. The concierges were limited in materials on hand to hand out. Plus they were not very helpful and didn't seem to know enough to be able to help. They were good for getting train info though. The doormen never once opened a door for me over the course of 4 days! And the revolving door is very stiff and hard to push so if you are not of great stregnth, use the handicap entrance. During our entire stay the bar area of the lobby was totally closed off leaving very little sitting/waiting area in the main lobby. Not comfortable or convenient as such. I guess they were renovating (?) The good things were that our room was spacious. And the location in Midtown is fantastic! You can walk to just about anything from the hotel. My husband was here for business while I got to enjoy the art museums and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfy beds.”
Reviews.Author: Mictrav2
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and beds were comfy. Bathrooms were nice as well. Not an overly fancy hotel but if you are looking for a great location and a clean place this is great. Elevators are slow on lower level floors.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel”
Reviews.Author: rsriram9
Reviews.Content: I expected a 5 star and a Marriott experience but got an average hotel in an OK location. The lobby is small and not impressive, the room decent but not great. Not great value for the money I paid ($259 plus taxes). Check-in was efficient and I had an express check-out. I would recommend this if nothing better is available and if one can get a good room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for quick access to transportation”
Reviews.Author: pjjenx
Reviews.Content: This is very close to Grand Central and all subway lines. So easy to grab cabs in front of hotel too. The bell staff is great to work with and will arrange your trip back to the airport for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: johnsonritae
Reviews.Content: Checked in 4/15 and had a corner room on the 12th fl. The noise was so bad I felt like I was sleeping on the sidewalk. Cab horns, police sirens, cars going over metal plate in the road and people talking all night in the street this went on until 5AM. Apparently there was a broken pipe in the street. They moved us to an inside room which was quiet and comfortable, however the water was still brown dirt and all until 10:00AM. We had to go sightseeing without a shower and no sleep. I would have made this up to the guest in some way but they just told us to run the water until it was clear! Concierce was excellent and so were the doormen. Two of the front desk staff were awful one was nice. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Central location for business travel and great service”
Reviews.Author: BradandJanet
Reviews.Content: I was booked into the Marriott by my firm as it was close to Park Avenue. The room was large and spacious with a good office chair and desk to work at. The bed was very very comfortable. The 'art deo' decor is not quite my thing but I coped. The bathroom was clean and well appointed. The best thing about my stay was the help I was provided when I realised that I had left my passport, Bose headphones and credit cards in the safe after I checked out! I was treated with respect and care and when I dashed back the conceirge had packed a gift for me as well! Tshirt, chocolates and a pack of playing cards. That was so nice and made me realise that hotels can be human and kind. I'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: SRHowdy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel over the weekend with my mom and brother. I was on spring break from grad school so we all decided to take a trip to NYC for the weekend. My brother is a government employee so he was able to get us a discount and when we checked in we got "upgraded" to the same type of room but just with a better view. The room was nice but nothing too special. The bathroom was great. It had a long counter so we could unpack our things and it had a really nice countertop. The room was sort of like a bowling lane the way it was long but not very wide. We still had plenty of room for our 3 suitcases and we could easily put them out of the walkway. The beds were pretty comfy but one complaint about them was the comforter. We had a room with 2 double beds and the comforter on one of the beds was made for a twin.. Well this was an issue since we had 2 people sleeping in this bed under a tiny comforter. The odd thing was the other bed had a normal sized comforter so the 2nd night we made sure we switched comforters. One of the beds was right by the door and if you slept on that side you could hear people coming in at all times of the night talking in the hallway. We never heard any noise from our rooms on either side but sleeping right by the door you heard everything! The concierge was so helpful at this hotel! My mom and I wanted Italian food for dinner so we asked if he knew of a good place. He recommended this restaurant which was about a 5-10 min walk away and it was the best italian food we have ever had! He even called ahead to get us a reservation. We are already planning to go back here the next time we are in NYC. The location of this hotel is what made it fabulous! It was a few blocks from shopping, rockefeller center, and not too far from time square. We loved how we were so close to everything without having to be right in the center of it. We will stay here again when we return to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, above average, hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ploaco
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean, the location was perfect but this hotel didn't "wow" me. I can't say exactly how good the service was because I never really came across any workers. I noticed all the security workers seem to congregate in the lobby each time I returned from an outing. I guess the one thing that does stick out, is that I was never once greeted with a "hello" by any of the Marriott staff. Other than that, our room was comfortable and met an above avg expectation. The room was nice and clean too!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: thefrequenttraveller
Reviews.Content: the location is excellent - just behind the waldorf and close to all the shopping, but not in the heart of it all as well. The lobby is very busy and the lack of service reflects this. The rooms were quite good - a little bit too much noise transfer, but comfortable all the same. In the end, it was good but nothing stood out. Next door you have the W and on the other side some boutique hotel, both of which make the marriott look out of date. Perhaps I should start collecting other points! Breakfast on Saturday was in a conference room. Frankly for 32 dollars it was not good enough. I went to the diner around the corner on Sunday and got as good food for half the price. So overall, OK, would recommend as a basic hotel if the rate was good (mine was).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel staff really friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel for a week we had only one thing bad to say is that the safe in the room didn't work so we had tk lock all passport in are suitcases

Reviews.Title: “it was simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: evelyn140400
Reviews.Content: We went to New York for our honeymoon on April 2009.We stayed at this hotel which is really in the centre of the world!!!!The location is outstanding ,the breakfast was suberb and everything was really amazing.The only thing negative was its price.Quite expensive for my pocket.But i really enjoyed staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: happywanderers82
Reviews.Content: I went to NYC for one night, and wanted a clean, safe hotel that was reasonably priced. Looked at many hotels, and made choice based on Marriott name, price (rewards member discount) and location. It was a nice walk from Port Authority, and easy access to Lexington Avenue line. Room was very clean, beds were comfortable, but temperature was a bit cold, and difficult to change. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but breakfast underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: asrosen
Reviews.Content: Good, comprehensive hotel, as one would expect. The desk clerk at check-in was very efficient and accommodating. The room, the result of a platinum upgrade, was lovely. Towels were on the thin and rough side. Breakfast food was OK (good oatmeal), with the exception of the cantaloupe, which was clearly well past its expiration date and inedible. This is inexcusable for a hotel of this stature.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: SEE1981
Reviews.Content: This Marriott has the advantage of an excellent midtown location, great for shopping and East Side. There is remodling of lobby and restaurant at the time, but there are current pricing specials that make up for that. Our stay put the staff to a test since one of our members suffered an accident ( hot at the hotel) and needed special assistance. They were very accomodating. The rooms can be small but it is an older buildling and everthing is well maintained and clearn. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lives up to Marriott Standards”
Reviews.Author: itbetterbeclean
Reviews.Content: Got a great weekend deal with rewards membership $169 plus tax. We arrived at 1 pm and were able to check in. Room with king was small but very comfortable. Everything was brand new, bed was great, bathroom was huge, room had mini fridge which is nice touch especially for NYC. Plenty of security in lobby of hotel so you always felt safe. Hotel restaurant looked like it was closed for renovations. Hotel was convenient to 5th Ave shopping, restaurants, bars, was a great home base for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good all-rounder”
Reviews.Author: Keith_in_London
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights on business. Overall, a good hotel in a very good location offering all that I need. Room quality was good - fittings were good quality and the bed comfortable. It was clean and a good size (both the room and bathroom). Clearly the room sizes vary (judging by other reviews) but mine was fine. I should add that I did switch rooms when I first saw it - not because of the size but because I wanted a room at the back. I mention this because it was no problem at all to switch so if one particular room is a problem then ask to switch - they were very helpful. The other things in the room were good. Aircon worked well; little coffee maker was great; and I appreciated the good quality steam iron in the room - these little things make a difference! I didn't use any amenities other than room service, which was fine. Took too long on one occasion (just over 50 mins) but no big deal. My only gripe is WiFi. $16.95 per day! Rip-off. However, I didn't use it and connected to another WiFi. I switched to this hotel after a disaster at Club Quarters on a previous business trip. I will be staying here again when next in town on business. If you're looking for funky/stylish then this place won't be for you, but for me, it got all the basics right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Typically Small NYC Rooms”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaRes
Reviews.Content: The New York Marriott East Side is well situated for visiting Midtown Manhattan. It is an older building, as you would expect due to the location, but the recent renovation has it looking clean and crisp for the most part. The usual Midtown tourist attractions (e.g., Times Square, Theater District, United Nations), as well as the stores and businesses of Park and Madison avenues are within easy walking distance. The rooms are nothing to write home about, but they meet expectations. Space is tight, which has been my experience for a standard room in Midtown Manhattan hotels. The quality meets the standard I've come to expect from Marriott. The concierge lounge, on the other hand, is spacious. It can get packed during the peak dining periods, but there's a lot of space and the quality of the food and beverage service meets expectations. Also, there's a patio for outside dining in the warmer months. It is the nicest Marriott concierge lounge that I have experienced in the US (newer Marriott properties in Asia have an even better lounges). The fitness center is small, but adequate. Room rates are variable, depending on time of year, but prices generally are competitive for this part of Manhattan. Summary: you get Marriott quality at a reasonable price. There may be a better value proposition in Midtown, but I've yet to experience it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment every time”
Reviews.Author: KateCinci
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC every few months and I've stayed at this hotel many times. Why? I love the location - it's midtown without the craziness of times square. However, I got sick of staying here. Why? The rooms stink. For $400 a night, you shouldn't have to smell mold (it's got to be in every room - I've stayed here at least 10 times). Marriott really needs to give this hotel a facelift.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WFVjr-21WD
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, NYC at Christmas, Great Location, What's not to like?

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, pricey Internet”
Reviews.Author: JMfromTO
Reviews.Content: Overall a good hotel. Comfortable bed, good size room for NYC and a nice bathroom. Rooms are oddly shaped but functional. Internet is $17.00 for 24 hours which is ridiculous but sadly becoming the norm. Breakfast is not included but you are so close to everything you can grab something at one of the 3 Starbucks around the block. Rooms are quiet, staff decent. Awesome location.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of Depressing”
Reviews.Author: molevin
Reviews.Content: My room did not have bedbugs, the temperature regulation was OK, it was reasonably quiet (although my room was in front of the elevator and there was some noise due to that), and nothing terrible happened. But the rooms are very small and tired, the view was of some other hotel rooms, and the bar in the lobby was loud, small and weird. The hotel insists on charging $16.95 per day for internet which is outrageous since it costs them almost nothing. The hotel is convenient to everything but I stepped into the lobby of the Hotel Intercontinental across the street and jealosy overwhelmed me. It was classy but cool at the same time, everything was spotless and there was classical music in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: BearVA
Reviews.Content: I had a strangely-shaped corner room at the Marriott for my last visit to NYC and I really enjoyed it overall. Like the room, the bathroom was also oddly shaped. You can tell the hotel's been "cut up" a lot over the years. Still, it was a typical Marriott room with all of the business travel amenities one would expect. Internet was expensive but bundled with free phone calls so I made the most of that service. Also, it can be noisy if facing the street but it's New York City after all! My first Marriott visit in New York since I usually stay at a Hilton property but it won't be the last.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location near great sights”
Reviews.Author: FuninPhx71
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott for 4 days. The hotel is nice, the staff is helpful. We were able to use the concierge lounge on Thursday, and that had a nice outdoor patio with great views. My husband used the gym and he said it was crowded, but an average gym. I used the hotel internet, which is $16.95 from noon to noon. As an FYI, there is no food available between 11 and 5 during the week there. Although the book in the hotel room says the Shelton Grill is open for lunch, it is not. Room service doesn't operate and the bar offers no food. It's not a huge deal as you can walk outside and find several places to eat, but when you are working and you want to grab a quick bite, you need to exit the hotel. The cleaning staff was very nice and prompt. I would stay there again, but I preferred the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff , great location”
Reviews.Author: joeinmiami
Reviews.Content: great location , nice rates compared to some of the other hotels near by. The rooms were a little small but clean . Would stay again !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Mac073
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times. The location is great and the staff is very helpful. Rooms are clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; big city hotel”
Reviews.Author: timbo59uk
Reviews.Content: Relatively recent refurb, and scaffolding still around the block. Reasonable size standard room with the usual facilities. One good point was the computer in the lobby connected to all the airlines allowing you to confirm and print off flight bookings. Very nice fitted gym on the roof!

Reviews.Title: “Most overpriced hotel I ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Michael-Traveller-JP
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 days end of September, having to pay $ 610 for an ordinary room with lounge access. The rooms are smallish and not special. No Minibar, little amenities, no information material about hotel, no stationery, not even a note pad. Even had to pay extra for Internet Access. The reception area is always crowded and noisy. The lounge offers mediocre breakfast. Elevator is slow and rather antique. Actually everything in the hotel feels quite old, and not in a good way. The service wasn't really bad, but can't really call the employees friendly or motivated. Bottom-line is: considering hotel prices in NYC, $ 300 would have been appropriate. But charging $ 600 is just a rip-off. It was booked by the company and some colleagues were staying there too. Thus no choice. Otherwise I would never have paid that much for it.

Reviews.Title: “NYC Marriott East Side pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: bower007
Reviews.Content: I've never stayed here before and I knew nothing about it before my stay; in a nutshell I thought it was a very nice hotel. All hotel staff were pleasant and courteous, from the front desk, to bar staff to room service. The room itself was very clean and the bathroom stocked with the most towels I've ever seen in a hotel room. While there was a mini-fridge in the room, it was not stocked. I wasn't in the room for anything but showers and sleep, so I did not use the internet connection but it was $16.95 for noon to noon service. Breakfast from room service was excellent, but very pricey. I stayed in this hotel for business, but I would stay here for a personal visit in the future. I can't think of one complaint; fellow colleagues expressed that they were happy with the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: lizzie03
Reviews.Content: Our check-in was booked for 3:00pm and finally got our rooms at 9:30pm. No apology, in fact front desk staff were rude - said go ahead and try to find another hotel on a Friday. Beds were ok, rooms small but good bathrooms. Good restaurant for breakfast. Again the front desk staff were rude given we waited HOURS for our rooms. Concierge very helpful for booking restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location—walls very thin”
Reviews.Author: americaninswiss
Reviews.Content: Won this hotel on priceline and was happy because of the location. Our room was quite big for NY standards. Other positives include the very nice fitness room located on the top floor. Lots of modern equipment and a view of Manhattan over the rooftops! Beautiful and what motivation to work out! Lots of restaurants and cafes in the area, central park just a few blocks away. Only negatives: Unlike other reviewers who couldn’t sleep because of the noise on the street, we didn’t have problem with that at all because our room didn’t face Lexington. Instead, we found the walls to be very thin and woke up several times in the night from other room flushing the toilet, running the water, returning to their room (and having conversations in the hall, slamming doors, etc.) I was disappointed that the wireless internet wasn’t free, even in the lobby. We would definitely stay here again as all in all it was a very good hotel and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, comfortable and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Alienreporter
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend in NYC. The Marriott East side was booked on-line as a package with Delta Airlines. We'd read all the reviews, both good & bad, and were very impressed with the cleanliness of our room (no 1111). The bed was very comfortable although being on the 11th floor you could hear the constant traffic and honking of horns all night. Front desk staff Carmen and Bell captain Ken very friendly and helpful. Great location for all the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Average - noisy”
Reviews.Author: njblanks
Reviews.Content: Seems more like a Courtyard than a Marriott. Very close to the American Girl store. Was on the 16th floor and I found it to be very noisy. No concierge lounge on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel, terrible management!”
Reviews.Author: Wrldtravler05
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently came to NYC and stayed at the Marriott East Side in midtown Manhattan. Overall, I found the hotel and the majority of it's staff to be quite charming and professional.The location is brilliant with easy access to trains and other public transportation. This hotel also offers a free concierge service that I found to be incredibly knowledgable and friendly. One of the best I have found in my travels. We did have a slight issue with our room as we booked a room with double beds however were given a room with only a single bed. My husband called the front desk and asked to speak with a manager. He was asked to hold which took almost 5 minutes and then was transferred to a manager named Veronica. He explained our situation and what our room should have been and was met with denials, lack of sympathy, and down right rudeness. The situation was eventually resolved however my husband said that in 25 plus years of traveling, he has never encountered such a dismissive and rude manager. Aside from this one issue, our room and stay in nyc was very enjoyable. Oh and if you are looking for quick bite to eat after a long day of sight seeing, you can go wrong with pj clarkes. Great burgers,staff and close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but could be a lot better...”
Reviews.Author: WestNorwoodWanderers
Reviews.Content: We're surprised by the number of positive reviews for this hotel. It's by no means an awful hotel, but it's not great either! Things we liked: - Stayed here on business, and from a work perspective it has everything you need - close proximity to the midtown district, high speed internet (at a cost), desk. - Fitness center had a wide range of machines, and a fab view over NYC - Room had everything you need - comfy beds, working a/c, tv with wide range of channels, fridge - Close to Grand Central station, making it very easy to get round the city. Things we didn't like: - The rooms have obviously been refurbished recently, but the windows are small, making the rooms feel very gloomy. - The rest of the hotel needs a makeover! - The staff are efficient - my check in was literally 30 seconds! But there's none of the personal touches or friendliness which is so common elsewhere in NYC, and makes you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: beechnut9
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the end of August. The location of the hotel is great. The only problem is that the noise level at night was very high. I think part of the problem is that there is a thru street right next to t he hotel, so there are lots of sirens and horns from vehicles going cross town. We were on the 9th floor in a corner room. The room, itself was fine, but I wouldn't stay there again due to the noise!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis amongst a sea of people”
Reviews.Author: mnmelody
Reviews.Content: I was in NYC for a little over a month on business and stayed at a could different hotels before finally finding the Marriot East Side. Wow!! What a great hotel! I am a tried & true Marriott fan, and had stayed at the Marriott Marquis my first week in and was horrified with the sheer number of people in/out of the hotel, as well as on the street (to be expected I guess when you're right on Broadway in Time Square!). By the time I found the Marriott East side I just needed a break from the people and the commotion, and this hotel was a dream come true! The hotel itself is beautiful!! It's an older hotel, but has been recently renovated to match the true Marriott style and comfort. From the moment you walk into the lobby until you get to your room, the hotel is luxurious, and beautiful. The staff is WONDERFUL!!! As a frequent business traveler, finding a hotel like this, is worth it's weight in gold! Just a few blocks from Rockefeller Center, Madison Ave. 5th Ave shopping, and a short walk to Time Square. The location is quiet, well, for NYC! The rooms aren't as large as the Marriott Marquis, but the atmosphere is a far cry from the "vegas" style atmosphere you get at the Marquis. If you're looking for a really NICE room, in a clean/quiet location, with a great hotel staff, stay here!! You won't be disappointed. And if you are.... you haven't stayed in enough bad hotels to know the difference! :)

Reviews.Title: “tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: imfletcher72
Reviews.Content: this hotel is indeed in a good area but the hotel is so tired it's sad. our room had crappy litle half-windows at the floor level (my wife said it was like being in prison), it had water-damage and rotting in the bathroom, the ac didn't work even after we called to complain so the room was unbearably hot (we didn't sleep well at all at this hotel), and so on. the hotel and overall experience there was crap. i actually took the time to write an email to the hotel to complain and the only response i got was to call the hotel. last thing a busy traveler/worker wants after they complain via email is to have to talk on the phone more about a bad experience. i suggest you steer clear of this VERY tired hotel. it's overpriced and just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “super comfortable beds and very quiet”
Reviews.Author: Shappy55
Reviews.Content: surprisingly quiet and great location. the bed was so comfortable, very nice expereince. Lobby leaves alot to be desired, but service and concierge was fine. would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: LizAnn28
Reviews.Content: Got there at 9:00 a.m. and we were able to get our room immediately. All the Hotel Staff were friendly and wonderful. There was a small glitch with our American Girl Package and they made it right and even added the concierage room. The manager called and then came to the room and gave me his card. I couldn't have asked for a better stay with my Granddaughter. I will be back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice room, great bed, great shower”
Reviews.Author: Debbeg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location - 49th & Lexington. The hotel is really nice - rooms are nice, beds are so comfortable. The shower is great. The rooms are nice and quiet - hard to believe you're in the middle of the city! The only bad thing was that the bar in the hotel closed at midnight - on a Saturday night!

Reviews.Title: “Always a Favorite”
Reviews.Author: kamikidd
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of my favorite hotels. Its not special beds or amenities that make it so awesome but the people. The staff is very friendly and dedicated to making everyone feel special in the sea of anonmyous faces in NYC. The rooms are clean, beds are comfortable. The TV is a flat screen with the plug-ins for computers. For gold and platinum members, the conscierge room is one of the best I have ever seen; the conscierge staff are the best people to visit with upon getting up and after a stressful day. Kenda always goes out of her way to be helpful and friendly!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nestje
Reviews.Content: For my second trip to NY I stayed for 7 nights at this hotel that was September '09 We were checked in in 5 minutes!! Great after a long time in traffic from the airport to the hotel! Our room was big enough en we had a very nice bathroom and a great view on the Waldorf!! We had breakfast in the hotel the first morning, it was very tastefull but too much food, so after that we took our breakfast at Café Metro! Connelly's is another place were you can eat very good!! 2 blocks down the hotel! The concierge was so helpfull! Thx to him we finally found the HBO shop! True Blood fans support each other! :) Wat was also good? Fith avenue was close by, Bloomingdale's ... Times Square! The only thing that I really didn't like was the noise at night! But that is NY I guess, that was the only bad thing! I really recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, 3rd time staying there 5stars*****”
Reviews.Author: sem366
Reviews.Content: This is our third time staying at the Marroitt East Side, traveling with a six year old! The hotel always had our room ready, rooms were very clean, room service wonderful!!!!! Very helpful with anything you needed. For nyc the rooms are quite big. Always feel very comfortable staying there. Walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller Center,etc. Would highly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure they don't bump you elsewhere due to overbooking”
Reviews.Author: totocas
Reviews.Content: I confirmed my reservation 10 days in advance for my 7-night stay, and when I arrived at the front desk, I was told there was no room available for my first night, and that I would have to make my own way to another hotel 2 blocks away. It was late, and I had already traveled 10 hours. They had already printed the letter for me to give to the 'back-up' hotel. In 12 years of business travel, this has never happened to me before, so I can't rely on this hotel from now on. That said, my room was ok, clean and comfortable. The front bar is a bit cold and lonely - the other hotels around would have been better options for a drink/bite to eat, especially the W hotel, which is probably where I'll book next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: saml0ves2travel
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a Virgin Holidays package for my partner's birthday. On arrival we didn't have to queue to check in and although our allocated room was nice and clean, it was very dark as we were directly facing a brick wall. I rang reception to ask if it was possible to move to a different room as it was a special holiday for us and we really wanted a room with a view. This was no problem and we were allocated a corner room on the 8th floor, it was so much bigger and brighter than the first room, so if you don't like your room for whatever reason it may be worth asking to move. The location of the hotel is good, about 15 minutes walk to Times Square. However, we did find the resturants were more expensive as we were staying in more of a business area than a tourist area but this was fine as I felt the service at the hotel was better because of this and we soon found some good places to eat within a short walking distance. There was also a shop nearby called Duane & Reade which sells snacks, drinks etc and there is also a Starbucks within just a couple of minutes walk. I wouldn't recommend buying anything from the hotel shop as this was very expensive. We found an Irish bar called O'Neills (about a ten minute walk from the hotel) which was really nice, the staff made us feel very welcome. One night they had live Irish music so if you like this kind of thing then it's well worth a visit. We also ate there one day for lunch and the portions were so big I didn't need anything to eat for the rest of the day! Good prices too. We ate in Ruth Chris' Steak House one night which is just off Times Square - highly recommended. You also decide on the tip you want to leave as this isn't added onto the bill like many places do. The staff at the hotel were more than happy to book this for us and arranged a cab for us too. We did all the usual tourist things and found it very easy and safe to travel around on the Subway but as the weather was so nice while we were there, it was nice to walk as often as possible as the hotel was in such a good location to Grand Central Station, Public Library, Central Park, Fifth Ave etc. When we left the hotel arranged a taxi for us to take us to JFK Airport, this was a huge private 4X4 type vehicle and was much more comfortable and cleaner then the yellow cabs. The price quoted was $55 including tolls and tip which was really good value and we would definately use this service again. We were also able to use the internet service free of charge in the Business Centre to check-in for our flights. Overall this was a great hotel in a fantastic location with top class service and we would definately consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but could have been better....”
Reviews.Author: robito
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for four nights and our stay was fine but could have been better. We arrived around 1:00 p.m. and our room was ready. Once we arrived in our room, the TV was not working properly. The room was clean except for the chair next to the bed which had not been cleaned around the seat borders for some time. The room and bathroom were a little too small for our liking. Some channels on the TV did not work at various times which was frustrating. One of the concierges was not helpful to recommend a restaurant near the hotel. He seemed a little cold and bored. Lobby area is too small and as a result is too crowded. Overall the hotel is nice but could improve on services. Need more smiles from staff at hotel restaurant!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay, would definately recommend”
Reviews.Author: Lovestravelling31
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 4 night stay at the Marriott. Thought the hotel was really nice. We only used the room so cannot comment on the restaurant or any other facility on offer. The room was nice, not massive but adequate. The beds although were comfortable were very small. The hotel was directly opposite the Wardoff Astoria, the hop on hop off bus stopped directly outside. Bloomingdales was situated further up the street. We ate breakfast at the Au bon Pain most mornings which was situated a few blocks up. Great choice and excellent value. Would definately recommend the hotel and hope to stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, convinient to everywhere”
Reviews.Author: rachel2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott NY East Side for 2 nights in Apr'10. We've stayed at the other two Marriott hotels (Marquis, Renaissance) but decided to go for the East Side Marriott this time. It proved to be a right choice. Things like at this hotel: -quiet location (compared to the hussle and bussle of Times Square) -walking distance to everywhere (15 min to Times Square, TKS booth, 20 min to Broadway theatres, 35 min to Lincoln center and theatres, 10 min walk to numerous restaurants and cafes/deli, 10 min to 5th Ave shopping and American Girl store) -clean hotel room, marble bathroom -large guest room (we had a king, plus roll away bed, still have room to walk ) -quick check out (check in took longer with some guests jumping the line) Things disliked: -very small lobby, it can get noisy when the lobby bar is open My two cents on getting around/things to do: -there's a garage parking right on 48th st, the same block where the hotel is, $54/24 hrs. We parked there and just walked around the corner into the hotel lobby. -Liberty Deli Cafe on 49th St. (2 blocks west from hotel) offers good varieties of food/drinks with good prices. The meals are sold by portions not by weight. For our family of 2 adults 2 kids it cost $18 for dinner, including drinks. -Shin Wong Chinese restaurant on 48th about 4 blocks to the West has the most authentic Chinese food around Times Square. We had 3 dishes for dinner for $23. Their soup noodle with wonton is very very good. We had 3 meals there and saw local people eat there too. -Variety Deli and Cafe almost next to Shing Wong is not so good. Food is not so fresh. They sell food by weight so a box of lunch can be more expensive than you thought. We walked to all the theatres of the shows we saw on this trip. ---the good: Phantom of the Opera (good as always), The 39 Steps (very good comedy), South Pacific (good musical) ---the bad: THe Gazillion Bubble Show (totally not worth the money in my opinion, even my 5 yr old was not thrilled, and we were sitting in 2nd row) Overall, we like the Marriott NY East and would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will never book here again, they make you wait 2+ hours after check in time”
Reviews.Author: mktrip1
Reviews.Content: And the rooms are tiny too. And no microwave in room, or anywhere else. The reason they said for wait was the hotel was sold out that day. Hello? If a hotel is sold out, people with confirmed reservations still wait for 2+ hours after arriving at scheduled check-in times? Also, in their rush to get the room ready, the linens were not clean, but had stains on them.

Reviews.Title: “I'll stay there again”
Reviews.Author: a_large_farva
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a weekend in the city with two family members. Great location and staff. Wonderful decor and very clean. Only complaints are the water pressure wasn't so good (18th fl) and the towels kind of smelled funny. Everything else was as expected from a Marriott. Breakfast buffett was decent, coffee at the buffett not so great. We'll go back there and will recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything but off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: lunarluau
Reviews.Content: My wife has stayed at the Marriott East Side on 3-4 occassions. I'm a frequent traveler to New York, but this was my first time. The thing I liked best about the Hotel is that it's close to so much without being in the middle of anything. Never had to deal with the irritating tourists, yet I could be in those heavily touristy areas rather quickly. The doormen did a great job, and our check-in was effortless. All of the hotel staff we talked to, includig the hotel General Manager, were super friendly and helpful. Nothing but good things to say. Will def stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended...”
Reviews.Author: PGBakes
Reviews.Content: Large hotel, even by NY standards, with a heavy gearing towards business but the location, quality and size of room more than make up for that. We were surprised how reasonable the rates were booking a good way in advance, and it was nice to be upgraded to a better room simply because one was available - why don't more places do that? Very helpful front desk when we needed them, though getting coffee replenished in the room was a bit of a battle. Excellent bed, slept very well. Well equipped bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Old and Won't Return”
Reviews.Author: drichrx
Reviews.Content: Came here on the recommendation of a friend. Used Marriott Rewards points and it was the cheapest (pointwise) of the full service Marriotts. Was convenient to the subway and buses. The gym was excellent (with excellent views) and the concierge room was above average. However, the rooms were small, cramped, and the hotel itself is very old. I have found other Marriott properties in Manhattan better, so I won't return.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: Austin101909
Reviews.Content: Our room with two beds was very big. The beds and pillows were incredibly comfortable and clean. They gave us bath robes that were great.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Efficient”
Reviews.Author: nycchic_10
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Marriot East Side. I have stayed at a number of NYC hotels and although this one is by no means luxurious, for the budget traveller this hotel is a great value. At check-in, the staff was very friendly. I had secured a low rate when I reserved and I was awarded a $25 gas card upon my arrival. I checked the bags early in the day but when the room was ready and they were returned to me no one offered to bring them to the room or escort us. Upstairs, the room was very small and felt like a dormitory. I could hear other guests in their rooms and the hallways. I looked at different rooms for a future visit and the hotel offers a variety of options to meet your travel needs. Enjoyed a lite breakfast on the premises, but the hotel food is unremarkable. As a former New Yorker, I know my way around but I inquired with the concierge for neighborhood suggestions because it was snowing. He had a useful menu book but was not well informed himself. The location is great, it's convenient to Grand Central, the UN. You can walk over to the Cathedral on 5th or Times Square easily. It's surrounded by other hotels and a choice of restaurants, mostly very expensive and meant for Midtown business expense accounts. I return to New York regularly and would stay again at the Marriot East Side, but I am in no rush to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: poohkin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott East Side for an anniversary weekend. The Marriott wasn't necessarily our first choice but we had a gift certtificate and saving money definitely made our decision for us. However, I am so pleased we chose this hotel. We mentioned it was our anniversary and got an upgrade at check in. King Bed, upper level floor with a seating area - very spacious and comfortable for NYC. The location is great. We were able to walk to Rockefeller Ctr, Central Park, Theater Disctrict, Times Square, etc. No problem getting a cab as the doormen were very helpful in hailing one outside the hotel. This hotel is a great value for a posh neighborhood in NYC. It was a great choice for a weekend we wish wcould have lasted longer in the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Extremely Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: JenniiFan
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay at the Marriott East Side was great. The location is perfect, convenient to the subway, plus easy walking distance to Rockefeller Center, Grand Central Station, Central Park, St Patricks Cathedral, etc. The hotel staff - from the frontdesk to housekeeping was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was impecable and the bed was so comfortable. We have stayed at a number of hotels in NYC and this facility is definitely our number 1 choice.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at in 26 yrs traveling”
Reviews.Author: sunydays33304
Reviews.Content: You want a small, clean, hotel in NYC with a solid nights sleep, this hotel is for you. This property has the feeling you are staying a lift type property. Small rooms, but able space. It seemed to me that many of the other guests were eurporeans. When I return to NYC, this will be the hotel of choice

Reviews.Title: “Good Convention Style Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TPXB
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at this Marriott. It is a typical convention style hotel and it is a very solid and predictable property. Check-in was easy and there was never a long wait for the elevator. The room was a good size and even pretty big for NYC. I had no problems with noise in the room and if you are looking for a bar go to Connollys on 47th.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet 16 Birthday Trip with daughter & friends”
Reviews.Author: byroad64
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel; room was nice size! Location was great for walking to all areas of interest: Grand Central Station, The Rock, Times Square, Central Park, 5th Avenue. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Small Room, Great Spot, Priced Right”
Reviews.Author: cook7166
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel, you could certainly tell the maintenance staff did well with the upkeep. The rooms are small; smaller than the courtyard on the east side. Overall it was a nicer hotel tho, and for the location the room size was expected. We had 2 rooms, it would have been nice if they had put both of them near one another, rather than separate floors. Otherwise, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luby9
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as part of a Virgin Holidays package and got a great deal. I couldn't fault the hotel, we were allocated a room on 3rd floor with 2 double beds, just as I had requested. We had a large room with LCD tv, a fridge, tea and coffee making facilities, hairdryer and iron and ironing board! Beds were very comfy, bathroom spotless, room was cleaned and new towels every day of our stay. All staff were very helpful and the hotel is within walking distance of most attractions and subway. I would definately recommend and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Walls are paper thin...Beware!”
Reviews.Author: OhioLauren
Reviews.Content: I understand this is an "antique" hotel built in the early 1900's..but you would think something could be done to soundproof the rooms! You can hear a pin drop next door...nose blowing...toilet flushing...you get the point. If I wouldn't have secured earplugs after the first sleepless night I wouldn't have slept a wink the entire week! The rooms overlook the Waldorf Astoria rooms and you can see people lounging in their beds...if you are loking for a view you wil not find it here. The rooms are extremely smal...even for 2 people and even for NYC. We've stayed nearly everywhere and these were by far the smallest rooms. Marriott Marquis has a better atmosphere and rooms are much nicer...there is just no "wow" factor here at all. Very sleepy place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jetsetsugar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were here recently for an overnight getaway in the city. We shopped, went to the Exhale spa on Madison and dined at The Four Seasons. Typically, we do not stay at Marriotts for our leisure trips. However, my husband used his accumulated points from business trips and it was perfect. This hotel is in an excellent location, close to all of the upscale shopping you could ever wish for. The room (a deluxe corner king) was clean, modern and rather sizeable--especially for New York standards. What really stood out, though, was the friendly and accomodating service from the valet parkers and doormen, to the front desk and lobby bar staff. I will definitely stay at this hotel again--even if I don't use points next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay; I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: cmcbass
Reviews.Content: Very nice updated room, but small. Since we were only there overnight, the size was fine. I would definitely stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay.”
Reviews.Author: mickeys
Reviews.Content: Just returned after a three night new york break. Our second visit to Marriott Eastside and we were as impressed as on the previous stay in 2008. Check-in was a breeze. Allocated requested room. Staff very friendly and helpful. Location of this hotel, tops its numerous assents. Easy walking distance to all the attractions, and it is on the green line (subway) for easy access downtown. Plenty of reasonable priced restaurants and deli's. Surrounded by shops. This location is just so ideal, not heavingly busy like on 5th Avenue and around Times Square, but it is just minutes to those places. The Rockafella Center is the 'tops' for christmas atmosphere. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jayney79
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Octopus and got an amazing deal of only £69 a night for a 4 night stay, what looks like an incredible saving for a hotel of this standard in New York! We arrived late in the evening and were checked in with speed. Although our room was on the 3rd floor with no view to speak of, we were in New York to sight see, and time in the room was for sleeping only, so it wasn't a problem. After hearing about the small size of rooms in NY, were were very pleasantly surprised by the room size. There was plenty of floor space. The bedroom and bathroom were very clean, and the bed comfy. We chose not to eat in the hotel, as it was expensive, but there's quite a few places nearby. The location is fab, only 5 mins walk to Grand Central Station, and less than half an hour to the Empire State Building and Times Square. The hotel provide a computer in the lobby to do internet check in for your flight home, and as the computer was in use, we were quickly escorted up to the business suite to save us time. One negative is that on the morning of our check out, we had an invoice under the door for charges to our room that we hadn't spent. Although not a lot, when we queried what this was on check out, without even looking at the invoice, reception told us it was a mistake and we wouldn't be charged - a bit strange. But overall, for the price we paid, this was an excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good for business but needs a better bar”
Reviews.Author: danielglak
Reviews.Content: It's a venerable seeming property with a great lobby and perfectly adqeuate, largish (for New York) rooms. I didn't have a chance to try the food but there doesn't seem to be anything resembling an actual separate bar. In the corner of the lobby, you can sit at the stick and order drinks but it feels like....well.....the lobby. Front desk staff were okay but overworked and not very helpful in that midtown tourist hotel way. Again, the weak dollar and strong Euro is filling the city with people who don't really speak enough English to travel in North America. But they do have the money!! Good proximity to most major midtown attractions and you're on the Lexington Ave. Subway line which is great for tourism.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great location, Great Price, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ado37
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay in the Marriott Eastside. I was a bit hesitant staying on Lexington Ave as on previous trips to NYC I have always stayed close to Times Square, but it was the best location ever. The hotel is located less than 5 minutes walk from 5th Ave and less than 10 minutes walk from Times Square. The staff were very friendly and efficient especially the Irish Porter from Donegal. He was so pleasant and helpful. We had room service one night as we could not walk any more after our day shopping. The food and service was great and only cost $70 for dinner for two with beer and tea included. Never again will I stay in hotels close to Times Square, I'll be staying in the Marriott. The concierge was great and organised a 'town car' for us to go the airport in and it only cost $75 including tolls and tips - again this is the cheapest fare we have ever paid to the airport from a hotel in NYC. This is my seventh trip to NYC and would have to say the best trip ever by far and this was all down to the fantastic hotel that I stayed in. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE AFTER CARE POLICY”
Reviews.Author: bee045
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in October for 4 nights with some friends. On check-in they swiped my credit card for extras. The hotel accommodation was part of an inclusive package with BA. I got my credit card bill on 11 November and the hotel has charged me $940. After 3 calls to the US nad 40 mins waiting a spoke to somone in business services. My credit card had been used to pay for another guest's stay. No apology and no explanation. The next day I got an email from Misty Gladdish of Business Services to say that she had not received any authorisation to refund me and would send me another update. I received no further emails from Misty Gladdish. On the 13th I phoned again and spoke to Amy who told me that the amount would be refunded. It's 19 November and no sign of the refund or any follow up email. I wrote an email to customer services asking them to explain how my credit card details had been used to pay for another guest's stay, whether that guest now had my credit card details as bills are posted to rooms and to date have received no response. I called the hotel itself and they said it was not their problem and you had to speak to customer services. Do you want to stay in a hotel which is this badly run? takes zero responsibility for the actions of their staff and uses your credit card to pay for other bills? AVOID!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: yaya41
Reviews.Content: This Marriot is located right in the heart of Manhattan, just a couple of streets away from the 5th Avenue and major attractions like the Trump Tower and the Rockfeller Center. The rooms have been fully refurbished and and the beds are very comfortable!!! You are in Manhattan but you don t get bothered by all the noise because the street where the hotel is located is pretty calm. The stuff is friendly even though the service is not excellent...the concierge seemed very sleepy and couldn t really help us to find a nice fish restaurant in the city?!? Beside that, we were pretty happy with the hotel. It is expensive indeed but then, if you think about it, you are in one of the most expensive cities in the world!! ı would reccomend this hotel to anybody who wantsd to go to NY and have a trouble free stay :)

Reviews.Title: “New York Noise but a Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Silver_Lake23
Reviews.Content: As usual, the Marriott service and standard of excellence did not disappoint. The location is phenomenal! You can walk or take the bus or subway to just about all the great Mid-Town hotspots in minutes. However, New York is a noisy city and the hotel is right on Lexington Ave., and frustrated New York cabbies are not loath to blare their horns. There are lots of sirens as well. If that's comforting to you, then this hotel is great. I slept pretty well because I brought ear plugs. It's a good idea. Otherwise, this hotel is charming and the room was immaculate. Also, there are some great little breakfast and lunch diners within walking distance, so if you don't feel like paying hotel prices, walk around; you'll find something.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bonalyn
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a one day conference on the recommendation of a Marriott Business Planner. The staff did a pretty good job to accommodate us, but when we arrived the morning of our presentation, the floor had not been vacuumed and there were broken pretzel pieces around the room. They did send a janitor to sweep the floor but it needed wall to wall vacuuming and we didn't get it. They made restitution by removing the room rental charge from my bill. I was pleased with this solution. Their staff did hang around to make sure that I was taken care of and they were quick to come when called. The food was great and looked so appetizing. Nice selection of menu choices. Do consider brining your own AVI equipment as the rental there is ridiculous! The location is terrific by Central Station. The Convention/Meeting rooms are very easy to get to in the hotel. The sleeping rooms leave a lot to be desired. While the bed was comfortable, my room was quite small. Nice Bathroom though, although my tub was clogged and wouldn’t drain. I feel there are much better options for the price in New York. Definitely not worth the $490+ price.

Reviews.Title: “My New York Hotel for Life”
Reviews.Author: fergfam
Reviews.Content: After having a terrific stay in a great location, with a great room, and great meeting faciliites, we saw first hand what excellent service above and beyond can be.... We left early for the airport....got their a lot earlier than need be....spent time over a long breakfast....and then with an 70 minutes before our flight, we realized we'd left the keys to our vehicle that was at an airport 2 hours from home, in the desk drawer at the hotel. I figured it would take 20 minutes to even find out if the hotel had found the keys....but no, 5 minutes later we get the call and they send a car to LaGuardia to deliver the keys! We got to the boarding gate before boarding started! On our drive home from the Airport 2 hours away from home, we got a call to make sure the driver had gotten us the keys and to tell us they'd love for us to stay again....I replied of course, we will. We'll never stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: szinaz
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was great. Very clean, the beds were sooooo comfortable,nice bar/lounge area for just hanging out waiting for friends. The hotel staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: guy_traveller
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this hotel. It wasn't awful, but I will look for somewhere else next time I am in New York. The room size was smallish, but not claustrophobic. The bathroom worked fine. They have refrigerators in the rooms, which is nice. The concierge lounge was fine, but the outside is closed due to construction. There was hammering outside a bit during the day because of construction - and this could be heard inside the room. Not a problem if you're out for meetings, but if you are working in the room, it is not so fun. There are good restaurants nearby and it is well located. There is a CVS up the street and a few places with takeout sandwiches.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Taste_It99
Reviews.Content: I recently spent five days at the Marriot East Side and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The staff was extremely friendly we arrived five hours before check in and an early check in was not an issue at all. I also forgot my toothbrush and 5 minutes after calling to the front desk one was delivered to my room. The location at 49th and Lexington is great for exploring midtown on foot. You are also only two blocks from the E,V and 6 trains which makes it easy to reach any where in Manhattan in around 30 minutes. I got a great deal on room $ and will definitely be staying here again on my next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: alexonhisown
Reviews.Content: Terrible hotel. This was our first trip to new york. If going again will stay somewhere else. Very unfriendly desk staff. Had read reviews about unfriendly staff and thought it didnt matter, but it does matter when trying to sort out problems. The internet didnt work in the room for our whole stay. Very annoying when I really needed to check my e-mails. They kept telling us it would be fixed soon. They got us to phone support who just left us on hold. The business centre is a joke. Two computers squeezed into a tiny corner, practically on top of each other, no privacy whatsoever. (very expensive to use). The girl at the desk in business centre was the most surly looking hotel staff member I have ever met. Our room looked out onto a building site. Our first night there seemed to be a generator operating all night. Luckily we were all so tired we slept through the noise. The noise stopped the next morning. When we mentioned it to staff we were told all rooms were full and if the noise came back to let them know. Luckily the noise didnt come back. Dont know what we would have done considering the hotel was supposedly full. I had read reviews that said bathrooms were small with no extractor fan. They are tiny and yes they get very stuffy and steamy. We had a room for 4 people and there was one tiny wardrobe. Be wary of the type of Taxi the Bell Boy gets you. He booked us a cab which we thought was the normal cab. 55USD incl. Tolls and tips It was a black car. They dont use tunnels or toll bridges. It took much longer to get to airport and we were nearly late for check in. Just get your own yellow cab outside hotel or insist on yellow cab.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: Four_Star_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Spent 9 nights here and enjoyed the stay very much except that they are building a new hotel next door and there is a lot of construction noise at night. I travel a lot so I always bring ear plugs just in case - front desk also offered them for free if you ask. To try and get away from the noise as much as possible, try to get a room with a low room number (ie: 1201,02 etc) the side with the construction is ##19+. We chose this hotel as you can walk to most of the mid-town attractions like Times Square, Central Park, 5th Avenue Shopping etc. in about 10-20 minutes. Subway is only 2 or 3 blocks away and Grand Central is about 6. Contrary to a previous contributor, we found everyone very helpful. If there was ever a line up at the front desk, they seemed to have staff floating in the lobby that came up to you to see if they could expedite your request. Everyone always gave us their names and volunteered their services personally if we were to call on them in the future. Concierge lounge only closes Friday afternoon to Sunday evening. Even though i am not a Gold or Platinum member I managed to get Lounge access by paying a few extra dollars which I think is worth it as you get free food and non-alcoholic drinks. So for the cost of 2 breakfasts downstairs, you can have free continental breakfast and all the bottled water you can drink for the duration of your stay. Restaurants I would recommend the are close are Avra (literally around the corner) and David Burke Towne House (10 blocks North). There is a 24 hour drug store 2 blocks south for anything you may need too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff, but amenities have deteriorated...”
Reviews.Author: mightaswellbaby
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Marriott East Side regularly for business, typically one-night trips. The location is fantastic, rooms are comfortable and the front desk and business center staff are always friendly and helpful. My most recent trip was my first multi-night (3) in a while, and I found the amenities disappointing. Room service is limited to 6:00am-11:00pm, and while there are small refrigerators in the room, there is no mini-bar - not very convenient for travelers that get in late and have to be up early for meetings (concierge level service wasn't even available). Most annoying was the wi-fi service, which was painfully slow!! It made it extremely difficult to get work done in my room. I will likely still stay at the East Side when in Midtown (convenient location, good value) but would like to see more functional amenities catering to business travelers, specifically faster broadband!

Reviews.Title: “A City Christmas”
Reviews.Author: Yesbut
Reviews.Content: For our Christmas vacation, we were able to take the train into Grand Central Station, and then right into the hotel without even going outdoors. Although we had seen a review that mentioned an unfriendly staff, our greeting could not have been nicer! We were greeted like old friends. The train station is very festive at Christmas time: a lovely arts and crafts fair (where I bought all my Christmas gifts), a periodic light show of the constellations on the ceiling (applause from the travelers often follows!) and, again, without braving the weather, we had a marvelous dinner at a steakhouse in the station. The concierge got us theatre tickets, we went to concerts, explored the city ,and all our suburban neighbors were very envious of our "Christmas travels" when the holday was over..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - shame about the rest!”
Reviews.Author: Trundler83
Reviews.Content: I booked the Marriott Eastside for a 4 night stay for a shopping trip with my sister due to its central location. I've stayed at several Marriotts before in the UK and Europe and have found them to be to a good, high 4 star standard. We booked a twin room (2 double beds). On arrival (late at night after a very long flight..) we were told sorry, we only have a room with one king bed for you. The hotel had overbooked on its twins and as a late arrival we were the unlucky ones. The receptionist agreed to put an extra bed in the room (you'd think they might have had they initiative to do this before our arrival given that a twin room had been booked!!). After much prompting he eventually said he'd try and move us to a twin the following day. Fine said we. The whole process seemed like trying to pull teeth, he clearly seemed to have no interest in us at all. After being given no info about the hotel amenities, we asked when breakfast was and were told until midday. Shame we came down the following morning to discover it was finished at 11. No-one we spoke to seemed in the least apologetic that the room type we booked wasn't available. Maybe this seems a small thing, but part of the reason we chose the hotel was to have a reasonable size room with 2 double beds, which few hotels offer. The room itself was very small - and i mean small. I am used to London hotel rooms which can be truly box like - in America you expect something larger! We had a panoramic view of a building site (drilling commenced at 7am) and a large brick wall. The website said the hotel had been recently refurbished but the only signs i could see of this in the bedrooms were the flat screen tvs. The carpet was tatty and there wasn't even a mini bar. The room felt stale and there was a rather unpleasant musty smell through the hotel, even in the towels. The bed I must admit was very comfortable (the king bed not the camp bed!). Next day we were told there would be no twin rooms available for the duration of our stay. After much probing for some kind of acknowledgment of the inconvenience caused to us, the staff eventually said they would move us to a larger room (still with king bed and camp bed style arrangement) and offered us a comp breakfast. That room must have been about 2 sq foot larger than the first. The view of building site remained, albeit a less noisy side of the site! On checkout, the receptionist charged the bill straight to my card without even showing a print out first - (this is just common politeness?!) I then had to ask them to refund the complimentary breakfast - which they had charged us for !! - back on to my card. The biggest issue for us was the lack of service offered. I understand that hotels get full and don't always have the right rooms, but not once did anyone apologise for this or offer anything as a solution - i had to push all the way for a room move. I work in the hotel industry and know what is possible with a tiny bit of effort and a smile. When travelling to America, with it's famous friendly service we expected better. Maybe this hotel does too well purely just from its location and feels that service is not necessary. I was really disappointed - I would have expected much better from a brand like Marriott. For those looking for a nice hotel in this area - try the W hotel next door!!

Reviews.Title: “great location excellent value”
Reviews.Author: cardiffwaffles
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 5 nights first visit to new York. excellent location very central. Room 2 double beds recently refurbished. Fridge in room was very handy and safe. very clean friendly all you could ask for. Booked via octopus travel and had a superb deal of £65 a night !!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: A_hui_hou_lifeisgood
Reviews.Content: It was fabulous to walk to Central Park, the Met, up 5th avenue and drool at all the windows. Or walk over to Rockefeller Center for drinks & photo opts. We Loved this hotel!!! We received a high floor (26) and it was a corner unit which was great for 3 ladies BUT we only had ONE bed.....it was a king and we did get a roll away....but it would have been nice to have 2 beds. I heard many people complaining at the front desk...they just don't have enough rooms with double beds. Would I stay here again???? Absolutely!!!! The location is prefect! Easy to grab train, bus or cab. So much to see in the area. On our way to the airport the bellmen hooked us up with a towncar $40! included: fare, tip and tolls!!! thats the way to go......when we returned from lunch our bags were already in the trunk..... FABULOUS TRIP : )

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: jilliebeanz96
Reviews.Content: This hotel was at 49th and Lex, you can see just about everything from there.. walking distance. And yes, I know everything in the City is pretty much walking distance... but you could get to TONS of places no sneakers needed... if you know what I mean. Grand Central is like 10 short-blocks away, Central Park, Time Square, Rock Center "Today Show", shopping and restaurants.. Cheesecake at Juniors! A bit pricey for those that want to save moola for nights out... but if it's just location you are looking for then you save on taxi fare in the end. Both "huge" Tour Bus lines stop right infront.. Downtown Loop , Uptown Loop, Brooklyn Loop... etc. So you can get just about anywhere all day (every 15 minutes) Even the Ferry (Free Statue Ferry) drop off too. And the cost is about $50 for 48 hours.... so good deal. The guide is nice too... lets you know all about everything and you can stop all along the way. Concierge at the hotel can give you maps and they were really informative with all things local. You can order tickets and everything right there in the lobby. The service was a bit blah... very clean, but I found it odd that I ordered things that never came (not charged) but in the end... I wanted it!! lol The hotel does have great weekend packages so check those out before booking. We visited American Girl Doll store and they have a package for that (kids get a bed for their doll as part of the package - very nice). Concierge/Business center access isn't really worth it... unless you want to just snack. ($70 a day per person for Fruit Bars in the AM, Small Sandwichs in the evening and various cookies in the PM)... better off popping by CVS down the street (2 blocks) for $10 to buy the same thing... And rooms have frig!! The only thing that was the pitts in the end was the Elevators... run so slow... small too! Floors 16 and above are the greatest... but you might end up waiting 15 minutes for a ride on the lift.... Not sure why (maybe one was out of service or something).. the place holds functions as well so they are busy.. I wouldn't call the lobby quite but the floor our room was on was very peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: thomasclan4644
Reviews.Content: Valet service was quick and courteous. Check in was long and slow. Was told our room wasn't ready yet and gave me a slip of paper and said they would call me. We waited in the hotel lobby, would have been better if the lounge was open. It did eventually and had a drink, very nice bartender. People were checking in and going immediately to their rooms so I ventured back to the desk and asked and lo and behold the room was ready! Was not given a reason why I didn't get called. We had a room on the 14th floor, two windows, adequate size for NY. Wish it was higher as the street noise was loud early in the a.m. Downfall was the bathroom door was a step away from the bed. Room was clean and modern. The bedding was the best, felt like I was sleeping on a cloud. Bathroom updated too, but could use a fan, but was clean. Hotel cleaning crew were very polite and always said hi and had a smile on their face. Plus was also having a refrigerator and safe in the room. Checkout was quick and valet service too. The hotel is close to Grand Central Station and we walked to Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Central Park with no problem. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SashaP
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our friends, stayed at this hotel for three nights this past weekend. We loved the hotel and have no complaints regarding our stay. The location was perfect and the rooms were plush, clean, cool, and updated. Our view was a slightly obscured by the scaffold that an earlier reviewer mentioned but we were still pleased. The staff was very courteous especially William, the security officer. The hotel was in walking distance of the Rock, NBS studios, etc. Also there were several late night eateries, which we frequented. I also like the fact that the drug store was one or two blocks away and we were able to buy water bottles and milk to place in the fridge provided in the room. The hotel was also right across the street from the Waldorf=Astoria- if you have a chance, walk through the W=A for a beautiful view. The subway was around two blocks away as well. We would most definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, comfortable and value for money”
Reviews.Author: GiveMeTheCityAnyDay
Reviews.Content: On arrival the front desk dealt with us efficiently. The only complaint I had was that the doorman did not help me with the bags to my annoyance. The room was quite small compared to what I am used to in hotels but more than adequate and was big enough for 2 double beds. It was well decorated and fresh. It had a work desk big enough for my laptop computer and other electrical items. The room also had another table and chair and a flat panel LCD TV. There was a good wardrobe (closet) for hanging clothes and storing the luggage. The bathroom was quite small but again, more than adequate and very clean. Marriott offers wired and wi-fi internet access. I had problems connecting to the wi-fi but after a call to the front desk they put me through to a help line where my issue was dealt with in less than 5 minutes. Wi-fi is a bit pricey though. I used Boingo as an alternative afterwards. We did not use the restaurant but did use the bar after sightseeing in the City all day. Try the Brooklyn Lager it is really quite good. For breakfast we ate at the Midtown Restaurant on East 55th Street. This was much better value than the hotel breakfast. When you step outside the hotel there are many amenities. Restuarants, bars, coffee shops etc. To stock up on water and snacks for the day, there are a couple of pharmacies very close by. Unlike in Britain, the pharmacy/drug store is also a convenience store. The main chain is Duane Reade. Take a left out of the hotel entrance on Lexington Ave and walk for a minute or two to find the nearest one. Overall, the hotel is comfortable and clean and the staff efficient. I am very fussy when staying in hotels and would have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, expensive broadband!!!”
Reviews.Author: MrsDallas
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at this hotel. The location was central and pleasant, and by NY standards, the room was a good size with very comfortable bed, fridge, the usual amenities. The view was not great and for the first few days made worse by scaffolding - I'd have appreciated a warning at check-in that extensive building work was being carried out directly outside our window (I opened the blinds to be faced with a lot of burly men on scaffolding - awkward moment). The hammering and drilling commenced before 7am most days but thankfully stopped a couple of days before the end of our stay at which point we could see daylight again! The staff were excellent - pleasant and courteous - very helpful. One major gripe is the cost of the internet connection - $16.50 per day or thereabouts. I think we now live in an age where we expect this service for free when staying in a decent hotel. Other than that a nice stay and I'd probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Clans53
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been happier with the size of the room, cleanliness and location. Minutes walk from Rockefeller Center and Grand Central Station. The staff was VERY helpful and friendly. We also got an unbelievable price $139/night with AAA discount!!! Even the reservationist couldn't believe it. It was the perfect comfortable stay during an event packed weekend - Ballet, Paul McCartney, Ellis Island, Metro. Mus. of Art and Restaurant Week! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobby11135
Reviews.Content: Stayed here only one night. Really nice hotel, cheap prices.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, great hotel"”
Reviews.Author: katConnecticut
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect hotel for our famiy of five for an overnight to celebrate my 15 year old's birthday.
